clinical_study.brief_title: Circumferential Spread of Anesthetic and Success in Sciatic Nerve Blockade
clinical_study.official_title: Does Ensuring Circumferential Local Anesthetic Spread Improve the Success of Ultrasound Guided Sciatic Nerve Block at the Popliteal Fossa?

brief_summary.textblock: Current practices when performing any peripheral nerve block may or may not involve ensuring circumferential spread of local anesthetic around the nerve. Ensuring circumferential spread can involve several redirections of the needle above and below the nerve, and potentially could result in either more discomfort for the patient or an increased chance of inadvertent direct trauma to the nerve. Not ensuring spread around the nerve may result in a slower and less complete blockade. The investigators suspect that by ensuring complete spread around the nerve, the speed of block onset would be quicker because it avoids the loss due to diffusion time.

primary_outcome.measure: Onset time of sciatic nerve blockade.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 5 minutes for 30 minutes after anesthetic injection

secondary_outcome.measure: Block success, time required to perform block, complications/adverse events, number of needle passes, patient discomfort

clinical_study.condition: Sciatic Nerve Blockade for Foot/Ankle Surgery

arm_group.description: Ensuring circumferential spread of local anesthetic around the sciatic nerve.
Single shot injection of local anesthetic near the sciatic nerve will be performed, without ensuring circumferential spread.

intervention.description: The anesthetist will ensure, under ultrasound guidance, that local anesthetic (1 mL of 1% lidocaine) surrounds the sciatic nerve.

The anesthetist will perform a "single shot" injection of local anesthetic (1 mL of 1% lidocaine) near the sciatic nerve under ultrasound guidance, without ensuring circumferential spread around the nerve.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. English-speaking
2. ASA physical status I-III
3. 18-85 years of age, inclusive
4. 50-110 kg, inclusive
5. 150 cm of height or grater
6. Scheduled for elective foot or ankle surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Contraindications to sciatic nerve block (e.g., allergy to local anesthetics, coagulopathy, malignancy or infection in the popliteal area)
2. Significant peripheral neuropathy or neurologic disorder affecting the lower extremity
3. Pregnancy
4. Contraindications to, allergies to, and/or past adverse reactions to study medications (local anesthetics, opioid analgesics)
5. History of alcohol or drug dependency/abuse
6. History of long term opioid intake
7. History of significant psychiatric conditions that may affect patient assessment
